sentences.en: And the Philistine cursed David by his gods.
sentences.cn: 非利士人就指著自己的神咒诅大卫.

sentences.en: But Abishai the son of Zeruiah helped him and struck down the Philistine and killed him.
sentences.cn: 17但洗鲁雅的儿子亚比筛帮助大卫,击打那非利士人,将他杀死.

sentences.en: Contemporary stereotypes of the bourgeois a grasping philistine ought to therefore be nuanced.
sentences.cn: 作为把握当代资产阶级庸人定型因此,应该细致入微.

sentences.en: David did as God commanded him , and they routed the Philistine army from Gibeon to Gezer.
sentences.cn: 达味就照天主所命的行了,击杀培肋舍特人的军队, 由基贝红直到革则尔.

sentences.en: David lived in Philistine territory a year and four months.
sentences.cn: 7大卫在非利士地住了一年零四个月.

sentences.en: David saw two men standing in front of the Philistine army.
sentences.cn: 大卫看到两个站在腓利士军队前面的人.

sentences.en: For forty days the Philistine came forward every morning and evening and took his stand.
sentences.cn: 那非利士人早晚都出来站著、此四十日.

sentences.en: Giant from Gath a Royal Philistine city.
sentences.cn: 他是非利士的皇族城迦特人.

sentences.en: I believe he seriously thinks me an awful Philistine.
sentences.cn: 我相信,他真的认为我是个不可救药的庸人.

sentences.en: Philistine army should have surrendered and not run away.
sentences.cn: 非利士的军队照理要投降,不应该逃走.

sentences.en: The philistine attitude of the public resulted in the work being abandoned.
sentences.cn: 由于公众对艺术不感兴趣,那个作品备受冷遇.

sentences.en: The philistine attitude of the public results in the work being abandoned.
sentences.cn: 由于公众对艺术不感兴趣,那个作品备受冷遇.

sentences.en: Then the Philistine came on and approached David, with the shield - bearer in front of him.
sentences.cn: 撒上17:41 非 利士人也渐渐的迎著大卫来.拿盾牌的走在前头.

sentences.en: When it comes to art, the man’s a philistine.
sentences.cn: 说起艺术，这个人是一窍不通。

sentences.en: When Saul and all Israel heard those words the Philistine, they were dismayed and greatly afraid.
sentences.cn: 扫罗和以色列众人听见非利士人的这些话, 就惊惶,极其害怕.

trans.tran_en: If you call someone a philistine, you mean that they do not care about or understand good art, music, or literature, and do not think that they are important
